Boston.com
10

Wakefield man faces more than 100 sex abuse charges

John Burbine, 49, allegedly videotaped himself as he raped and sexually abused 13 children -- some as young as eight days old, while providing day care at their homes, the Middlesex DA said. (Globe, 3:49 p.m.)
  • 12/3 Parents on alert as child sexual abuse cases grow

Man is 5th biker killed in Boston this year

Christopher Weigl, 23, a graduate student at Boston University was killed in Allston today when he collided with a tractor-trailer. (Globe, 4:04 p.m.)
  • Pictures Scenes from the Commonwealth Avenue crash
Watch

Speedo run: Prepping for a flash dash

Santa Speedo Run training

The annual race-in-the-near-raw may happen just one day a year, but for some, it's a way of life -- one of numb legs and being very comfortable in your skin.
  • Join RadioBDC at Lir in Boston to cheer on runners
  • Pictures Scenes from the Santa Speedo Run 2011

Green Line operator held second full-time job with Boston Housing Authority

The man fired after last week's crash worked overnights at the Boston Housing Authority and drove for the MBTA by day, records show. (Globe, 4:03 p.m.)
  • T fires trolley operator | 11/30 Equipment failure ruled out
  • 11/29 35 taken to hospital after Green Line crash
  • YouTube Surveillance video of crash | Crash scenes

Mass. officials find problems at three more compounding pharmacies

Three firms found to have problems in how they prepared or stored drugs have received cease and desist notices from the state. (Globe, 3:41 p.m.)
  • 12/5 Rhode Island spa kept drugs recalled by pharmacy
  • 12/4 Pharmacists request changes in state regulations
